frameDefinitions: The Authorities hold a Suspect under suspicion of having committed a crime (Charges).
A person, the Cognizer, thinks about a Topic over a period of time.
A Guest stays for a time at a Location, which is not his or her permanent residence, for some Duration.
A Patient is committed to the care of a medical Facility by a proper Authority.
An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage.
Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.
frameExamples: The police <t>held</t> Mr. Smith in the slammer on charges of killing his lawyer.
The men were silently <t>mulling</t> <t>over</t> the proposition of committing an assassination
I usually <t>stay</t> with my aunt at her summer house when I go to Seville.
Ten years after Abraham Lincoln's assassination, a Chicago court declared his 56-year-old widow Mary insane and <t>committed</t> her to a mental institution.
As soon as he stepped out of the bar he was <t>set</t> upon by four men in ski-masks.
The police <t>arrested</t> Harry on charges of manslaughter.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Authorities</fen> hold the <fen>Suspect</fen> in custody.
This role identifies the person who is taken into custody and held, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
When the detaining occurs.
Where the detaining takes place.
With a target verb, the Cognizer is usually expressed as an External Argument, with the Topic appearing as an Object NP, a gerundive verbal Complement, or a PP.
With a target verb, the <fen>Topic</fen> is usually expressed as an Object NP, a gerundive verbal complement, or a PP.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> considers the <fen>Topic</fen>.
The <fen>Guest</fen> remains for a relatively short period of time in the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Location</fen> where the <fen>Guest</fen> spends a short amount of time.
The length of time that the <fen>Guest</fen> remains at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Host</fen> is living at the <fen>Location</fen> on a permanent basis, and is allowing the <fen>Guest</fen> to stay there.
The time at which the temporary stay takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates the larger physical setting of the temporary stay.
The person who is committed to a facility with a view towards helping them mentally or physically.
The facility where the <fen>Patient</fen> is taken for treatment.

The <fen>Authority</fen> is the actor carrying out the institutionalization with proper legal authorization, either invested into them in general by the government or granted due to power of attorney over the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The time interval during which the institutionalization happens.
The location in which the <fen>Facility</fen> is situated.
This role is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<fen>Charges</fen> identifies a category within the legal system; it is the crime with which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is charged.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> charge the <fen>Suspect</fen> with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody.
The <fen>Suspect</fen> is taken into custody, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
<fen>Offense</fen> identifies the ordinary language use of the reason for which a <fen>Suspect</fen> is arrested.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arrest occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arrest occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> considered a career change.
Pat considered <fex>a career change</fex>.
Originally, <fex>we</fex> planned on rooming with our relatives in Reno.
Originally we planned on staying <fex>at the Hilton</fex>.
My wife and have just returned from a <fex>two day</fex> stay at Ocean Key.
You should avoid staying <fex>with old college buddies</fex> when on business trips.
He'll be lodging here <fex>next month</fex>.
<fex>In London</fex>, I stayed at a hotel.

Buffy's got this hospital phobia because her caring parents institutionalized
<fex>her</fex> for a while before she moved to Sunnydale.

Unfortunately for Mrs. Lincoln, her son, Robert, institutionalized her <fex>in the
Batavia Asylum</fex> shortly after the visit to St. Charles.
Goodrum then went to see <fex>a private doctor</fex> <fex>who</fex> hospitalized him.
<fex>Later</fex> her mother became depressed and was institutionalized.

The widow of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. suffered a stroke on Wednesday, and was
hospitalized <fex>in Atlanta</fex>.
The mysterious fighter attacked <fex>the guardsmen</fex> with a sabre.
<fex>The mysterious fighter</fex> attacked the guardsmen with a sabre.
<fex>As soon as he stepped out of the bar</fex> he was set upon by four men in ski-masks.
Then Jon-O's forces ambushed them <fex>on the left flank</fex> from a line of low hills.
The police arrested Harry <fex>on charges of manslaughter</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.
The police arrested <fex>Harry</fex> on charges of manslaughter.
They arrested Harry <fex>for shoplifting</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>in front of his house</fex>.
